Zebras are native to Africa and can be found in the grasslands, savannas, and woodlands of sub-Saharan Africa. They are most abundant in eastern and southern Africa, but can also be found in parts of Angola, Botswana, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe.
Zebras are found in the savannas, grasslands, and woodlands of Africa.
